abstract: A column of typed values in a data table.
overview:
## Overview

A column is a homogenous collection of data values, similar to an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Array]. Columns are the main components of an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable] and are designed to efficiently scale with large data sets.

Typically you use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn], the typed equivalent to [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn], to work directly with the column’s element type. A data column has extra math and statistics functionality when its element type is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Int] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Double].

# MLDataColumn

**Structure**

A column of typed values in a data table.

## Declaration

```swift
struct MLDataColumn<Element> where Element : MLDataValueConvertible
```

## Overview

A column is a homogenous collection of data values, similar to an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Array]. Columns are the main components of an [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataTable] and are designed to efficiently scale with large data sets.

Typically you use [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLDataColumn], the typed equivalent to [doc://com.apple.createml/documentation/CreateML/MLUntypedColumn], to work directly with the column’s element type. A data column has extra math and statistics functionality when its element type is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Int] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Double].

## Creating a data column

- **init(repeating:count:)**: Creates a new column with a repeating element.
- **init(_:)**: Creates a new column from a given sequence of elements.
- **init()**: Constructs an invalid Column.

## Creating a data column by converting another column

- **map(to:)**: Creates a new column by converting this column to the given type.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of machine learning sequences from a given column whose elements can be converted to sequences.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of integers from a given column whose elements can be converted to integers.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of arrays of integers from a given column whose elements can be converted to an array of integers.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of doubles from a given column whose elements can be converted to doubles.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of arrays of doubles from a given column whose elements can be converted to an array of doubles.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of strings from a given column whose elements can be converted to strings.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of arrays of strings from a given column whose elements can be converted to an array of strings.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of machine learning sequences from a given column whose elements can be converted to sequences.
- **init(column:)**: Creates a new column of machine learning dictionaries from a given column whose elements can be converted to dictionaries.

## Getting the number of elements

- **count**: The number of elements in the column.
- **isEmpty**

## Getting an element

- **subscript(_:)**: Accesses the element at the given row.
- **element(at:)**: Accesses the element at the given index.

## Appending to a data column

- **append(contentsOf:)**: Appends the elements of the given column to the end of this column.

## Duplicating a column

- **copy()**: Returns a new MLDataColumn by copying the original MLDataColumn

## Sorting elements to generate a column

- **sort(byIncreasingOrder:)**: Returns a new MLDataColumn containing values sorted by the specified order.

## Transforming elements to generate a column

- **map(_:)**: Creates a new column by applying the given thread-safe transform to every non-missing element of this column.
- **mapMissing(_:)**: Creates a new column, potentially with missing elements, by applying the given thread-safe transform to every element of the column, including missing elements.

## Masking elements to generate a column

- **subscript(_:)**: Creates a subset of the column by masking its elements with a column of Booleans.
- **subscript(_:)**: Returns a `MLDataColumn` containing only the elements for which the corresponding mask has a nonzero or non-default value.

## Discarding elements to generate a column

- **dropMissing()**: Creates a subset of the column by removing all elements without a value.
- **dropDuplicates()**: Creates a subset of the column by removing all duplicate elements.

## Selecting elements to generate a column

- **subscript(_:)**: Creates a subset of the column, given a range of elements.
- **subscript(_:)**: Creates a subset of the column, given a range expression of elements.
- **prefix(_:)**: Creates a subset of the column, given a number of initial elements.
- **suffix(_:)**: Creates a subset of the column, given a number of final elements.

## Filling in missing elements to generate a column

- **fillMissing(with:)**: Creates a modified copy of the column such that every missing element is replaced with the given value.

## Evaluating elements to generate a column

- **materialize()**: Creates a new column by immediately evaluating any lazily applied data processing operations stored in the column.

## Combining columns

- **+(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by adding the given double to each element of the given column.
- **-(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by subtracting each element of the given column from the given double.
- ***(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by multiplying the given double by each element of the given column.
- **/(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by dividing the given double by each element of the given column.

## Combining columns to generate a column

- **+(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by adding each element in the first column to the corresponding element in the second column.
- **+(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by adding each element in the first column to the corresponding element in the second column.
- **-(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by subtracting each element in the second column from the corresponding element in the first column.
- **-(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by subtracting each element in the second column from the corresponding element in the first column.
- ***(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by multiplying each element in the first column by the corresponding element in the second column.
- ***(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by multiplying each element in the first column by the corresponding element in the second column.
- **/(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by dividing each element in the first column by the corresponding element in the second column.
- **/(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by dividing each element in the first column by the corresponding element in the second column.

## Combining a column with a value to generate a column

- **+(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by adding each element of the given column to the given integer.
- **+(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by adding each element of the given column to the given double.
- **-(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by subtracting the given integer from each element of the given column.
- **-(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by subtracting the given double from each element of the given column.
- ***(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by multiplying each element of the given column by the given integer.
- ***(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by multiplying each element of the given column by the given double.
- **/(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by dividing each element of the given column by the given integer.
- **/(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by dividing each element of the given column by the given double.

## Combining a value with a column to generate a column

- **+(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by adding the given integer to each element of the given column.
- **+(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by adding the given double to each element of the given column.
- **-(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by subtracting each element of the given column from the given integer.
- **-(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by subtracting each element of the given column from the given double.
- ***(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by multiplying the given integer by each element of the given column.
- ***(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by multiplying the given double by each element of the given column.
- **/(_:_:)**: Creates a column of integers by dividing the given integer by each element of the given column.
- **/(_:_:)**: Creates a column of doubles by dividing the given double by each element of the given column.

## Comparing columns

- **==(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is equal to each element in the given column.
- **!=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is not equal to each element in the given column.
- **<(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is less than each element in the given column.
- **<=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is less than or equal to each element in the given column.
- **>(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is greater than each element in the given column.
- **>=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is greater than or equal to each element in the given column.

## Comparing columns to generate a column of booleans

- **==(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the first column is equal to the corresponding element in the second column.
- **!=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the first column is not equal to the corresponding element in the second column.
- **<(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the first column is less than the corresponding element in the second column.
- **<=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the first column is less than or equal to the corresponding element in the second column.
- **>(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the first column is greater than the corresponding element in the second column.
- **>=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the first column is greater than or equal to the corresponding element in the second column.

## Comparing a column with a value to generate a column of booleans

- **==(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the given column is equal to the given value.
- **!=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the given column is not equal to the given value.
- **<(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the given column is less than the given value.
- **<=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the given column is less than or equal to the given value.
- **>(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the given column is greater than the given value.
- **>=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether each element in the given column is greater than or equal to the given value.

## Comparing a value with a column to generate a column of booleans

- **==(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is equal to each element in the given column.
- **!=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is not equal to each element in the given column.
- **<(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is less than each element in the given column.
- **<=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is less than or equal to each element in the given column.
- **>(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is greater than each element in the given column.
- **>=(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by testing whether the given value is greater than or equal to each element in the given column.

## Combining columns of booleans to generate a column of booleans

- **&&(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by performing a logical AND operation on each element in the first column with the corresponding element in the second column.
- **||(_:_:)**: Creates a column of Booleans by performing a logical OR operation on each element in the first column with the corresponding element in the second column.

## Getting the min and max element values

- **min()**: Returns the element with the lowest value in a column of doubles.
- **max()**: Returns the element with the highest value in a column of doubles.

## Getting sum, mean, and standard deviation values

- **sum()**: Returns the sum of the elements in a column of doubles.
- **mean()**: Returns the arithmetic mean of the elements in a column of doubles.
- **std()**: Returns the standard deviation of the elements in a column of doubles.
- **stdev()**: Returns the standard deviation of the elements in a column of doubles.

## Visualizing a column

- **show()**: Provides a visualization for the data in the column.

## Getting a description of a data column

- **description**: A text representation of the column.
- **playgroundDescription**: A description of the column shown in a playground.
- **debugDescription**: A text representation of the column for debugging.

## Handling data column errors

- **isValid**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the column is valid.
- **error**: The underlying error present when the column is invalid.

## Supporting types

- **MLUntypedColumn**: A column of untyped values in a data table.

## Default Implementations

- **CustomDebugStringConvertible Implementations**
- **CustomPlaygroundDisplayConvertible Implementations**
- **CustomStringConvertible Implementations**

## Adding columns

- **addColumn(_:named:)**: Adds an untyped column to the table.
- **MLUntypedColumn**: A column of untyped values in a data table.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomPlaygroundDisplayConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
